fields.description: Sometimes I want to make a comment on a line further up from the diff, and I notice that the comment bubble goes away for greyed-out lines. I’d really like to be able to comment on those lines, as well.
fields.summary: Commenting on lines other than those in (and around) diffs

fields.description:
Usually, when I send a pull request to multiple people, I’m trawling - whoever gets there first can approve the pull. But sometimes, I actually want two separate people to *both* work through the change and approve it. The stash web interface does not seem to have any way to express that.

When/if stash learns to automatically advance radar state, this will become more than a nice-to-have - I need to be able to say “don’t advance the radar until both X and Y have approved this.”

Suggestion:
1. Allow me to mark a reviewer as required - all required reviewers must approve for the request to be complete.
2. Allow to specify a number - any N reviewers are required to complete the request.
fields.summary: Stash should let me express multiple-approval requirements

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimised pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us, including support for linking directly to lines in the diff from comments. 
 You can now click on the line number in the gutter to deep link to that line, similarly you can right click and copy the link from the line number and paste it into a comment, where it will be automatically formatted when rendering the comment. The link will be in the form of {{#filePath/filename?f=123}} for the "from" side of the diff (context and removed lines) and {{#filePath/filename?t=123}}  for the the "to" side of the diff (added lines)

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Michael McGlynn
 Bitbucket Server Developer
{panel}
Sometimes I want to refer to another line or function in a comment I’m making on a commit or PR. It’d be great if Stash added some way to generate a link to another line (or even a function, by name) inside of the Markdown syntax for comments.

Perhaps something like:

See #345old.

Where `old` is used to designate the line relative to the file that’s being patched, and `new` would refer to the line relative to the file as it would be after the diff is applied.
fields.summary: Referring to lines in comments

fields.description: Pull requests currently show test failures as build failures.  They should have a separate line item to show that tests are failing, but builds are passing.
fields.summary: Stash pull requests should display test failures different from build failures

fields.description: For projects with many old pull requests, to find the most recent requests, a user has to keep scrolling down the page and letting Stash load newer and newer pull requests.  It would be useful to reverse the sort order of the list, to show the newest pull requests at the top.
fields.summary: Reverse sort order of pull requests

fields.description:
Our network only allows multicast to work on specific IPs. We want to leverage multicast to dynamically add members to the pool, but need to specify the multicast IP.

In Confluence [this is done in confluence.cfg.xml|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/cluster-troubleshooting-203618.html#ClusterTroubleshooting-Multicast] as the "confluence.cluster.address". However, [the bitbucket.properties file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Installing+Bitbucket+Data+Center#InstallingBitbucketDataCenter-6.Startthefirstclusternode] doesn't have a documented parameter to do this.

Including such a configuration on Bitbucket would be beneficial
fields.summary: Allow specifying the multicast IP for Hazelcast in Bitbucket Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to know which repositories each Stash user has committed to most recently.  Is that possible?

The reason I would like this is that our company has zillions of repositories, there's only a 1-level organization scheme within Stash (the Projects scheme), and it can be very difficult to find what someone's (e.g. even myself) is doing these days.
fields.summary: User-to-repository reporting

fields.description:
We just started a PR to merge a branch that included a lot of file moves, and I'm a bit disappointed to see Stash's "diff" behavior. (We're using Stash 3.10.2)

It shows moved files as brown-colored filenames, but does not give you any indication whether the file has been changed (or only moved) until you actually click on an individual file and look at the right-hand panel, in which case you either see a diff, or the indicator "The contents of this file have not changed". It also does not tell you the change in filename path unless you hover over the `MOVED` label in the right-hand panel

This isn't a big deal if you just have a few files. But we just did a reorg where we moved about 100 files, so it's a LOT of work to click on each one and see "oh, that's just a move" for 95 of those 100 files but find the 5 files that have actually had changes as well as a move.

*There needs to be a better way to see diffs where there are a large number of moved files, without having to click on them one at a time.*

- *Please add a quick indicator in the left-hand panel to distinguish files that have changed from files that have not changed.* (because they've been moved, in the latter case)
- *Please add a better indicator of move events* so it is possible to see the source and destination path more easily for a large set of moved files. Perhaps you could show a list, like:

{noformat}
foo/file1.c -> bar/file1.c
foo/file2.c -> bar/file2.c
spam/file3.c -> eggs/file3.c
{noformat}
fields.summary: improve PR diff display when file moves occur

fields.description:
I tried to upgrade from Bitbucket-Server 4.0.2 to 4.0.3 using the X64-MSI installer and ran into the following problem:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9882024/stash-installer-stuck-on-windows-2003 - without finding this "answer" while having this problem

With help of Atlassian support I was pointed to this problem and solution.( https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/24/SSP-10997)

*Problem:* The section _"If upgrading from a previous version of Stash where the Stash home directory is owned by a local user, the ownership of all files will be updated to atlstash . Please allow sufficient time for the installer to complete this process (it could take up to 30 minutes)."_ is *only available on Stash-upgrade guide* (https://confluence.atlassian.com/stash/stash-upgrade-guide-292127009.html) *but not on Bitbucket upgrade guide anymore* (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-upgrade-guide-776640551.html).
These implies - at least for me - that this problem is gone with migration from Stash to Bitbucket ... but that's not true:

*Suggestion:*  put this section on Buitbucket-Server upgrade guide as well ...
fields.summary: Enhanced Bitbucket-Server upgrade guide

Pre-condition:
For this repository 1 reviewer is required, set via the default pull-request menu of the repository. 

When creating a pull-request, it is possible (for a small amount of time) to press the merge button of that pull-request, even when no reviewer is set. After a couple of seconds the button will be disabled.

Note:

"Required approvers:
You need 1 more approval before this pull request can be merged."

fields.description:
Commit messages are uncapped in indexing workflow and hence may cause high heap memory consumption and {{OutOfMemoryError}}.

h4. Workaround
Increase heap if the index is still processing commit messages (no way to determine if this is still happening).

h4. Notes
Forking the repository and pushing to the fork will trigger an index on the forked repo.
fields.summary: Large commit messages may cause high heap memory consumption

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a {{README.md}} in Stash, if you have a {{table}} definition in a code block, {{class="aui"}} gets appended to the table definition in the render of the readme on the repository page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a {{README.md}} in your repository.

{noformat}

```xml
<table-definition>
</table-definition>
```
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
{{class="aui"}} does not get added.

h3. Actual Results
{{class="aui"}} is appended to the table definition when the readme is rendered.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.

fields.description:
{panel}
NOTE: This issue affects all versions of Bitbucket Server and Stash.

h3. Cause

Firefox 41 [introduced a change to their encoding handling of URL hashes|https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093611#c67]. When given a value, they now encode it if required, but don't decode it again when the value is read back out. This causes our file tree to mismatch the hash against the file name and fail to find the selected file since it is comparing the decoded version against the encoded one.

h3. Workaround

If you are comfortable setting flags in your browser, you can set {{dom.url.getters_decode_hash}} to {{true}} as a temporary workaround. This flag can be set by visiting the URL "about:config", confirming that you understand the implications, searching for "dom.url.getters_decode_hash", and double-clicking the {{false}} value cell. *NOTE: once the issue is fixed in Bitbucket Server, you will have to set this flag back to {{false}} to avoid seeing similar errors with filenames that are already percent-encoded.*
{panel}


The newest stable version of Firefox (41) can't switch files in a commit or pull request file tree when one of the files contains spaces.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Visit a commit or pull request page that contains files with spaces in the name (or in the directory)
3. Select the second or further file

Expected:
The selected file is shown in the content

Actual:
The first file is shown, but the URL reflects the file you clicked.
fields.summary: File tree doesn't work with Firefox 41 or greater when invalid URL characters in filenames

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Workflow triggers don't work if Bitbucket Server is on SSL, and has a [Security Constraint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Redirect+HTTP+Requests+to+HTTPS] configured to redirect requests from HTTP to HTTPS. 
Removing this security constraint from Bitbucket Server fixes the issue.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 6.4.11
 * Bitbucket Server 4.0.1, and Stash 3.11.2
 * Self-signed certificates (separate certs) for both JIRA and Bitbucket Server to run over HTTPS, hostname {{localhost}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up JIRA and Bitbucket Server on SSL as per [BitBucket server ssl docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/securing-bitbucket-server-with-tomcat-using-ssl-776640127.html] and [JIRA SSL docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html], both with their own self-signed certificates.
 # Set up security constraint for JIRA: ({{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/web.xml}})
{code:java}
   <security-constraint>
  <web-resource-collection>
    <web-resource-name>all-except-attachments</web-resource-name>
    <url-pattern>*.jsp</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>*.jspa</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>/browse/*</url-pattern>
  </web-resource-collection>
  <user-data-constraint>
    <transport-guarantee>CONFIDENTIAL</transport-guarantee>
  </user-data-constraint>
</security-constraint>

{code}
For Bitbucket Server: {{$BITBUCKET_SERVER_INSTALL/atlassian-bitbucket/WEB-INF/web.xml}})
{code:java}
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>HTTPSOrHTTP</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/status*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <user-data-constraint>
        <transport-guarantee>NONE</transport-guarantee>
    </user-data-constraint>
</security-constraint>
<security-constraint>
     <web-resource-collection>
         <web-resource-name>HTTPSOnly</web-resource-name>
         <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>
     </web-resource-collection>
     <user-data-constraint>
         <transport-guarantee>CONFIDENTIAL</transport-guarantee>
     </user-data-constraint>
</security-constraint>

{code}

 # Add server's self-signed certificates to both JIRA and Bitbucket Server's respective keystores.
 # Applink both JIRA and Bitbucket Server.
 # Go back to JIRA, and try adding a workflow trigger.

h3. Expected Results
 # Workflow triggers are added successfully without problems.

h3. Actual Results
 # The workflow trigger fails to add with error in UI: !WorkflowTriggerFail.png|thumbnail!
 # In the Chrome dev tools, we can see the capabilities check for the workflow trigger fails:
{code:java}
appLinkDiagnosticResults: [{name: "Stash", type: "Stash",…}],…}
appLinkDiagnosticResults: [{name: "Stash", type: "Stash",…}]
0: {name: "Stash", type: "Stash",…}
accessible: false
icon: "https://localhost:8444/jirassl/s/en_US3u0el9/64026/4/4.3.10/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/types/16stash.png"
inboundStatus: "UNKNOWN"
local2LOConfigured: "NOT_TESTED"
name: "Stash"
outboundStatus: "UNKNOWN"
remote2LOConfigured: "NOT_TESTED"
supportedVersion: false
type: "Stash"
working: false
devToolsDocoUrl: "https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-064/Integrating+JIRA+with+Code+Development+Tools"
dvcsDiagnosticResult: {pluginConnected: true, dvcsAccountDiagnosticResults: []}
dvcsAccountDiagnosticResults: []
pluginConnected: true

{code}

h3. Notes
 # No errors in both JIRA and Bitbucket Server logs.
 # *Removing* the security constraint on *Bitbucket Server*, and then restarting, fixes the problem.
 # Note that all other applink functionality (dev panel, viewing JIRA issues in Stash etc) works without problems, only the Triggers are affected by this.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround if you absolutely need to include the security constraint in Bitbucket Server.
In contrast, the workaround is to remove the constraint for Bitbucket Server only.
fields.summary: Workflow Trigger creation fails when Bitbucket Server is on SSL with security constraint configured to redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS

fields.description:
h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define a custom field in JIRA, e.g. "Colors".
# Add this field to a project, e.g. "GUS"
# Create an issue in JIRA, e.g. "GUS-1" and assign a value, e.g. "Green", to this custom field.
# Make a commit and comment with the JIRA issue ID.
# Push to Stash
# In Stash click on the JIRA issue ID in the Issues column.
# Transition the issue by clicking "Done".

h3. Expected Results
The value visible in JIRA in the custom field, e.g. "Green", is also visible in the modal window.
!2015-10-15_1337.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The custom field is visible without a value:
!2015-10-15_1337_001.png|thumbnail!




If the issue is transitioned, the existing data "Green" in JIRA is removed.
fields.summary: Persist custom field value on Issues modal during transition

As build server we use Jenkins and for that we use the Hook "Bitbucket Server Webhook to Jenkins". When I commit something on to the branch, the build is triggered.

fields.description:
Would like to have hierarchy or nested projects.  This is helpful for organizing large numbers of git repos.  For example the EE department creates an EE project to contain all of the git repos that EE department uses.  Under the EE project would 3 development programs. Under each program would be the actual projects: fpga firmware, arm software, test code, and so on.

Over the course of several years about 60 unique projects are created for about 15 products.  Nesting helps organize the projects instead of having 60 projects in a single list.  

The categorizing add-on attempts to address this issue.

This similar to BSERV-2468.
fields.summary: Add hierarchy to Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bitbucket Server users are able to push a SSH2 key type to a repo as an "Access Key"

!http://monosnap.com/image/IK3yp1QT1iZ9WrbfAAIiuJPgXUtGZ5.png|height=200!

In certain scenario (we couldn't reproduce it yet), a customer reported that Stash will strangely assign the push to the {{---- END SSH2 PUBLIC KEY ----}} user that does not exist in the system but only as part of the SSH2 key type.
!Pull request.PNG|height=300!

*How does Stash do it?*

When a Stash/Bitbucket server user pushes to a repo using SSH, the PR will register the changed pushed by the email address that is used _in the SSH_. This email will be mapped against the email address of a Stash/Bitbucket Server user and his/her username will be shown.

In the example above, Stash/Bitbucket Server that mapping seems to happen incorrectly due to this bug.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

We could only reproduce the fact that Stash/Bitbucket Server accepts the upload of SSH2 key type. However, in our documentation we don't guide the users to use that.
# [Create SSH keys|https://confluence.atlassian.com/stash/creating-ssh-keys-420973584.html#notfound]
# [Convert them to SSH2 type|https://burnz.wordpress.com/2007/12/14/ssh-convert-openssh-to-ssh2-and-vise-versa/]. I used the following command:
{noformat}
ssh-keygen -e -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub > ~/.ssh/id_rsa_ssh2.pub
{noformat}
# Upload the content of {{id_rsa_ssh2.pub}} to Stash/Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results
Stash/Bitbucket Server will reject the key.

h3. Actual Results
Stash/Bitbucket Server accepts the key.

h3.Workaround
Do not use SSH2 keys in Bitbucket Server.
If that was the case and you had pushes using SSH incorrectly assigned to the {{---- END SSH2 PUBLIC KEY ----}} user in PR updates that you want to be fixed, please raise an issue with https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server should not accept SSH2 keys

fields.description:
In Stash Data Center 3.11.0 a hidden {{hibernate.cache.mode}} property was added to allow selection of {{LOCAL}} Hibernate cache mode instead of {{DISTRIBUTED}} (the default). 

In {{DISTRIBUTED}} mode, all nodes in the cluster pool their memory to cache DB entities but it can require a large number of inter-node operations to get and put entities. In {{LOCAL}} mode, each node caches entities independently and still requires inter-node communication to invalidate entries, but this communication is all asynchronous.  {{LOCAL}} mode has shown significant performance and reliability improvements over {{DISTRIBUTED}} mode in performance testing and on production instances. 

In Bitbucket Data Center 4.0, the new default value for the {{hibernate.cache.mode}} property is {{LOCAL}}, but can be overriden to {{DISTRIBUTED}} to get the previous (Stash 3.x) configuration.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Data Center: Make LOCAL mode Hibernate cache the default

fields.description:
Bitbucket doesn't keep track of any mapping between JIRA projects (or components) and in what repository (or repositories) corresponding branches get created. This should be made easier, smarter and less error-prone.

Original description:
Specifically, what I would request would be the ability to add multiple "Create Branch" links, each of which defaults to a specific repository, and shows up as "Create <Repo Name> Branch". We would use this to have a "Create Code Branch" and "Create Content Branch" link that each default to creating a branch in the site or content repository, respectively.

We've had three or four cases (at least) of people creating branches in the wrong repository in the last two weeks. Then they get confused when they can't find the branch, because it was created in the wrong repository
fields.summary: Smarter repository selection when creating a branch from JIRA

fields.description:

Since the missing requirements are only needed for the installer, it would be nice to have a flag that could be passed to the installer where it would extract the bundled JRE to run the installer, but the system JRE would be used to run Bitbucket Server once the installation was completed.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of Mar 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

As already noted, we're excited to have shipped the first iteration of work in this area earlier this year in v7.9, available for those running Bitbucket Data Center in a clustered environment.

This allows you to upgrade to our security patches and bugfix versions on minor releases with no downtime for end users. E.g from 7.9.0 -> 7.9.1. We know that for those of you who stay on versions of Bitbucket for longer periods, particularly LTS releases, this will allow you to easily keep patched without downtime. 

You can read more about it in the release notes [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-and-data-center-7-9-release-notes-1037993528.html] and see an overview of an end to end upgrade experience on our Data Center Video Library page [here|https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/data-center/data-center-video-library].

We're not stopping here though. We're continuing to investigate how we can eliminate further downtime and look forward to giving more concrete updates on this in the near future.

As always, if you'd like to be involved in feedback sessions, we'd love to speak to you. Please reach out at rsaunders at atlassian dot com

 Rob Saunders
 Product Manager - Data Center
{panel}
*Original Description:*
 Currently it is not possible to upgrade Bitbucket Data Center with zero downtime, as the cluster never allows nodes with mixed versions.

If upgrade tasks between versions allow it, it should be possible to upgrade Bitbucket Data Center one node at a time, so that there is little or no loss of availability during the upgrade process.
fields.summary: Upgrade Bitbucket Data Center with zero downtime

fields.description:
We have a custom field called "Needs Documentation?" that has possible values of 

* User Docs
* User Release Notes
* User Docs & User Release Notes
* Internal Docs
* No

If a user sets the state in JIRA and moves the ticket through the ticket workflow (_Submitted_, _In Progress_, _Resolved_, _Closed_) that state is maintained.  However, if the ticket is updated via Stash when a PR is open,  Stash just pulls in the enumerated list for the pull down and sets it to the first option in the list -- "User Documentation".  This means someone can inadvertently change the value of a variable without knowing it.
fields.summary: Stash changes state variables without user interaction

fields.description:
Situation:
James opens pull request, selects Frank as reviewer
Frank makes comments
James fixes comments
Frank reviews pull request and is happy with the contents
James pushes another commit
Frank's browser isn't updated and clicks the Approve button, before reviewing the last commit

Unless Frank realizes that James pushed another commit, he would have blindly approved James's last commit

Is there a workaround for this?  Maybe Bitbucket should have some ajax that refreshes the pr overview page to update if a new commit is added?  Or just prevents a user from approving if the screen he's looking at doesn't reflect latest commit actions?
fields.summary: Bitbucket should have a way of letting a user know there are more commits

fields.description:
Stash uses Hibernate L2 caching which can be configured in two modes: {{DISTRIBUTED}} and {{LOCAL}}.  Stash versions up to and including 3.11 are hard wired to use {{DISTRIBUTED}} mode, but can be configured to use {{LOCAL}} Hibernate cache mode by modifying hidden properties. 

In Stash Data Center versions prior to 3.11, the L2 Hibernate caches in {{LOCAL}} mode may intermittently become inconsistent.  If affected by the consistency issue, it looks confusing (for example, Pull Request reviewers may appear different on different cluster nodes) but there is no possibility of data loss or other bad effects as a result of this. The actual data in the DB is fully consistent and any cluster node that is out of synch will reload the true state from the DB eventually, either the first time the PR is modified (for example) or when the data in the caches expire or get evicted.
fields.summary: Improve consistency of Hibernate L2 cache, especially in LOCAL mode on a cluster

fields.description:
The Bitbucket Server 4.0.2 Linux {{.bin}} installer bundles JRE 1.8.0_60, however after installation completes the installer tries to start the instance using what is defined as JAVA_HOME. If JAVA_HOME is pointing to Java 1.7 the instance won't start because Java 1.8 is required.

There's no point in packaging the required JRE if it's not used.
Maybe the startup process could check if JAVA_HOME is pointing to 1.7 and:
* If it is pointing to Java 1.7, use the JRE_HOME included in the package.
* If it is pointing to Java 1.8, use JAVA_HOME.
fields.summary: If JAVA_HOME references an invalid version, start with the built-in version instead

The only methods are described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/migrating-users-between-user-directories-426116517.html].

fields.description:
When Bitbucket Server is started, we should prevent the application from running if the database or home directory is of a newer version than the binary.

Currently, we log a warning, but we should prevent the server from starting.

{code}2015-09-30 11:50:23,379 WARN  [spring-startup]  c.a.s.internal.ApplicationSettings The configured home directory /home/bitbucket is at a higher build version 5.10.0 than the Bitbucket code build version 5.3.2{code}

It would be better to prevent this mismatch from continuing on so that the administrator can take the appropriate action if this is unintentional. If intentional, it would be ideal to have a flag or configuration parameter that could be used to allow the application to start.

h4. Diagnosis

At some point a newer binary was used to start the application which upgraded the data directory (logging this here: {{BITBUCKET_HOME/.version}}) and possibly the database.

h4. Workaround

h5. You accidentally started the application with an old binary
# Stop the application.
# Start the application using the correct, newer, binary.

h5. You are attempting to recover from a failed upgrade
h6. Option A
# Stop the application.
# Roll back the file system to the point immediately prior to upgrade (this must match the database).
# Roll back the database to the point immediately prior to upgrade (this must match the files system).
# Start the application with the original binary. 

h6. Option B
# Stop the application.
# Open a Support Request at support.atlassian.com indicating that your upgrade failed, include the version you are currently on and the version you want to upgrade to, and attach the latest application log file (e.g. atlassian-bitbucket.log).
fields.summary: Prevent startup of Bitbucket Server when the data directory (BITBUCKET_HOME) is newer than the application being started

Otherwise, what's the point in taking in the pull request id for this function?

Is there a workaround that I can manually check to see if a comment is part of a pull request?

# Use the [Quick Start with Bitbucket Server and AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/quick-start-with-bitbucket-server-and-aws-776640254.html] guide
## This uses the template from {{http://atlassian-software.s3.amazonaws.com/templates/bitbucket/BitbucketServer.template}}
# After Bitbucket Server starts, create a new project and repository
# Push some content to this Git repository
# Access the repository at the {{http://<BITBUCKET_URL>:7990/projects/<PROJECT>/repos/<REPO>/browse}} URL and the error will be displayed
fields.summary: ActiveObjectsInitException: bundle [com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-repository-ref-sync] when viewing repository on fresh install of Bitbucket Server 4.0

fields.description:
*Scenario*
* Stash/Bitbucket Server integrated with HipChat.
* User pushing to the repository via SSH.
* SSH key at repository level.

When the user performs the push, the author of the commit is shown as "Access key user" instead of his name in the HipChat room:
!hipchat.png|thumbnail!
Hovering the link shows [http://hostname:7990/bots/a0fcb68d29b4abac]

The username is shown properly in the commits list in Stash/Bitbucket Server.
If the key is added to the user profile, the username shows up properly in the HipChat room, and hovering it shows a link to the profile: [http://hostname:7990/users/grefosco]
fields.summary: HipChat integration: committer shown as "Access key user" when SSH key is added to repository

fields.description: As a user of both Jira and Stash I would like to see the associated Jira ticket numbers of a pull request in the dashboard that lists all opened and merged pull requests.
fields.summary: Show Associated Jira ticket in Open/Merged pull request menu

fields.description:
1. I commented on some code in the Diff section
2. The comment appears in the Overview's Activities
3. When I go the file that I commented on (either via Diff or clicking on the file link under Overview's Activities), the comment doesn't appear anywhere

We're running Stash v3.11.1
fields.summary: Pull request comments do not appear on file

fields.description: Specifically on this page, Stash isn't able to transcode non UTF-8 characters (in this case, Russian) as per screenshot !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!. However, it is able to render normally in source/diff view (with Transcode diff enabled)
fields.summary: BitBucket Server (Stash) isn't able to transcode non UTF-8 specifically on README file

fields.description:
Dear,

We just upgraded from Stash 3.x.x to Bitbucket Server 4.0.1 and are experiencing the same issue as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Projects+disappear+on+upgrade+due+to+an+incompatibility+with+the+Bitbucket+Server+Project+Categories+plugin
We get an empty page (no categories shown in the welcome /projects page).
We are running version 1.2.0 of the plugin, released on 22nd of September, 2015.
Using this version, we don't see the error in the "atlassian-bitbucket.log" file mentioned in the knowledge base item above. It seems that the plugin silently fails to show the projects on the welcome page.
Can you advise on how to get this solved?

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Project Categories for Bitbucket Server empty projects list

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/integrating-bitbucket-server-with-apache-http-server-776640122.html

The steps for the above documentation does not apply for Debian/Ubuntu apache installations as the configuration file structure and steps to enable the modules are slightly different.

The documentation should be updated to look similar to the steps given in JIRA's Apache documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/integrating-jira-with-apache-185729645.html
fields.summary: Update documentations for Apache Proxy configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After setting [config properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Bitbucket+Server+config+properties] for Bitbucket Server and restarting it is not possible to easily check in the UI whether they are correctly picked up be Bitbucket Server or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add one extra page in the Administration to show all the properties or at least all the customised ones similar to the one present in FishEye/Crucible.

Attached a screenshot showing the FishEye page as a reference:
 !Screen Shot 2015-09-30 at 14.51.54.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an Administrator I would like a System Info page to see all config properties

fields.description:
h4. Problem
[Documentation states|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Using+branch+permissions] that branch deletion can be prevented by adding a specific permission to do so. However, the [pattern examples given|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Branch+permission+patterns] does not specify how to effectively prevent tag deletion.

h4. Proposed solution
Add {{refs/tags/}} in the list of examples for more clarity and explain how to prevent tag/branch deletion with more specific examples.

fields.description:
With the move to Java 8, we should bundle Scala 2.11 (which supports {{-target=jvm-1.8}} for {{scalac}}) to simplify allowing plugin developers to upgrade.

In the future we should probably do a better job of tracking new Scala releases and dual-bundling providers to enable transition. My proposal:
* 4.0: 2.10 and 2.11
* 5.0: 2.11 and 2.12
* Etc.

This approach allows plugin developers to stay on a given Scala version for at least 2 major release cycles. Since Scala tends to break all their third-party libraries with each new release, that extra time is likely to be important.
fields.summary: Bundle Scala 2.11

fields.description:
when using git submodules it's very easy for someone to forget to push their changes on a submodule, and push out the commit of that submodule on the parent. This can lead to repositories that aren't clonable anymore as there are missing commits for these submodules.

A plugin was developed a while ago (https://bitbucket.org/cofarrell/stash-submodule-safe-hook), but this needs to be upgraded to bitbucket-server-4.x

I was hoping someone on the Bitbucket team might be able to pick this up, and convert this to a standard offically supported plugin as this closes a giant hole in git, and can lead to serious issues.

Please see here for more details: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/30937228/stash-hook-to-prevent-unpushed-submodules
fields.summary: stash hook to prevent unpushed submodules

fields.description:
When I pull up a pull request page on my browser, I get a list of the files that have changed.
For each file, I get the diffs in a single view with the changes marked by grey, red (deletions) or green (additions) highlighting.

However when I click on the button for the "Side-by-side diff" the colored highlighting is now broken. It shows grey without the red/green in some of the places, where it used to show the changes. This makes it harder to read the differences.

I think it may happen in sections of code that have both deletions and additions because the sections that are only additions still show green and the sections that are only deletions show red. If a section of code has additions and deletions on the same line it just shows all grey and you can no longer see the characters that have changed
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff does not show proper highlighting

fields.description:
(1) Some of the links in the index are dead. For example, http://example.com/rest/api/1.0/hooks links to https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/stash/3.11.3/stash-rest.html#idp245872 which doesn't go anywhere.

(2) There are no examples requests for some of the endpoints.

/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/settings/hooks/{hookKey}/settings claims to have an example, but clicking 'expand' doesn't show anyting.

(3) Some parameters aren't documented.

/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/settings/hooks/{hookKey} does not document hookKey, nor give an example.

This seems like the REST endpoint that should give me settings for the (legacy) HipChat notification hook. I tried the obvious values, but no success:

/rest/api/1.0/projects/AB/repos/beta.research/settings/hooks/hipchat-hook-config-form/ -> HTTP 500

/rest/api/1.0/projects/AB/repos/beta.research/settings/hooks/com.atlassian.stash.stash-hipchat-integration/ -> HTTP 500

/rest/api/1.0/projects/AB/repos/beta.research/settings/hooks/com.atlassian.stash.stash-hipchat-integration:hipchat-hook-config-form/ -> HTTP 404

Using /settings doesn't help, and seems to ignore my key entirely:

/rest/api/1.0/projects/AB/repos/beta.research/settings/hooks/whatever-I-put-here-doesnt-matter/settings -> HTTP 204 every time

(3) The index ordering is inconsistent. 

http://example.com/rest/api/1.0/users/{userSlug}/settings lists GET before POST, but others vary, e.g. "http://example.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/{pullRequestId}/comments [POST, GET]"

fields.description:
{panel}
(i) *This is a particular pain point for our customers upgrading from Stash to Bitbucket Server with an environment which is running Java 7*
{panel}

h3. Summary

When Bitbucket Server fails to start because the running JVM set in the env variable {{JAVA_HOME}} is _not supported_ or is _incorrect_, the messaging is logged to {{<CATALINA_HOME>/catalina.out}} and the console output says it started successfully.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a server with {{JAVA_HOME}} ( in {{/etc/environment}} or similar location) pointing to Java 7 or incorrectly set to the {{bin}} directory (i.e. {{/usr/lib/jvm/oracle_jdk8/bin/java}})
# Install Stash {{3.x}}
# Upgrade to Bitbucket Server
# Start Bitbucket using {{$ sudo service atlbitbucket start}}

h3. Expected Results
- The console output informs the user that the configured JVM is not supported and they must upgrade in order to run Bitbucket Server
*OR*
- The application starts using its embedded JRE as opposed to an invalid or unsupported {{JAVA_HOME}}

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket Server tells the user the application started successfully. The messaging about the incompatible JRE is logged to {{catalina.out}} which is easy to miss for our customers producing support load.

{code:title= Output when you start Bitbucket as a service}
$ sudo service atlbitbucket start
To run Bitbucket in the foreground, start the server with start-bitbucket.sh -fg
Starting Atlassian Bitbucket as dedicated user atlbitbucket


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Bitbucket is being run with a umask that contains potentially unsafe settings.
The following issues were found with the mask "u=rwx,g=rwx,o=rx" (0002):
 - access is allowed to 'others'. It is recommended that 'others' be denied
   all access for security reasons.
 - write access is allowed to 'group'. It is recommend that 'group' be
   denied write access. Read access to a restricted group is recommended
   to allow access to the logs.

The recommended umask for Bitbucket is "u=,g=w,o=rwx" (0027) and can be
configured in setenv.sh
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Using BITBUCKET_HOME:      /var/atlassian/application-data/stash
Using CATALINA_BASE:   /opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0
Using CATALINA_HOME:   /opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0
Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/temp
Using JRE_HOME:        /usr/lib/jvm/jre
Using CLASSPATH:       /opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/bin/bitbucket-bootstrap.jar:/opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/bin/bootstrap.jar:/opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/bin/tomcat-juli.jar
Using CATALINA_PID:    /opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/work/catalina.pid
Tomcat started.

Success! You can now use Bitbucket at the following address:

http://localhost:7990/

If you cannot access Bitbucket at the above location within 3 minutes, or encounter any other issues starting or stopping Atlassian Bitbucket, please see the troubleshooting guide at:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServerKB/Troubleshooting+Installation
{code}

*Error in case of incompatibility with Java 1.7:*
{noformat:title=<Bitbucket_Install>/logs/catalina.out} 
Atlassian Bitbucket does not support Java 1.7.0_85. Please start the product with Java 8 or greater.
{noformat}

*Error in case of Java incorrectly set:*
{noformat:title=<Bitbucket_Install>/logs/catalina.out} 
./catalina.sh: 1: eval: /usr/lib/jvm/oracle_jdk8/bin/java: not found
./catalina.sh: 1: eval: /usr/lib/jvm/oracle_jdk8/bin/java: not found
./atlassian/bitbucket/bin/catalina.sh: 1: eval: /usr/lib/jvm/oracle_jdk8/bin/java: not found
{noformat}

h3. Possible Workaround

Removing a globally set {{JAVA_HOME}} would resolve the issue as well as the application will fallback to the bundled JRE, however this may not be an option for some of our customers as they might have other applications using their current {{JAVA_HOME}} value.

h3.Solution

Install Java 8 and set it as your {{JAVA_HOME}}. More details on how to set up your {{JAVA_HOME}} can be found on step #2 of the following document:
- [Install Bitbucket Server from an archive file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/install-bitbucket-server-from-an-archive-file-776640148.html]
fields.summary: Bitbucket will display error message when JAVA_HOME with wrong Java version is set

fields.description:
There are plugins in {{bitbucket-it-resources}} that AMPS automatically installs. For example:

{noformat}
-rw----     2.0 fat   129796 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/developer-toolbox-plugin-2.0.16.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat  1207253 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/rest-api-browser-3.1.3.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat   274075 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/bitbucket-it-resources-4.0.0.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat   515303 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/httpservice-bridge-0.6.2.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat    12502 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/pdkinstall-plugin-0.6.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat   155295 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/org.osgi.compendium-1.2.0.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat   507026 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/org.apache.felix.webconsole-1.2.8.jar
-rw----     2.0 fat   508649 bl defN 21-Sep-15 11:49 generated-resources/bitbucket-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/plugin-data-editor-1.2.jar
{noformat}

AMPs is normally the thing that installs these plugins when you run bitbucket:debug or bitbucket:run. The problem with putting them in the data is that it is not possible to disable them as they are in the home directory no matter the settings in AMPs. For example, the following just doesn't work.

{code}
                    <enableFastdev>false</enableFastdev>
                    <enablePde>false</enablePde>
                    <enableDevToolbox>false</enableDevToolbox>
                    <enableQuickReload>false</enableQuickReload>
{code}

This could also cause problems with versioning. You can tell AMPs which versions of the plugins to install. Having them in the data means that in-effect you have a created a minimum version that can be installed.
fields.summary: bitbucket-it-resources contains the DEV plugins that AMPS installs and controls.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing an upgrade from Stash 3.x to Bitbucket Server 4.0.0, Bitbucket Server fails to start when upgrading the database schema with the following error:

{noformat}
2015-09-23 12:00:39,453 ERROR [spring-startup]  c.a.j.s.w.s.JohnsonDispatcherServlet SpringMVC dispatcher [springMvc] could not be started
org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'crowdUserDao' defined in class path resource [crowd-spi-context.xml]: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 1 of type [com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.ProjectDao]: : Error creating bean with name 'projectDao' defined in URL [jar:file:/opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/atlassian-bitbucket/WEB-INF/lib/bitbucket-dao-impl-4.0.0.jar!/com/atlassian/stash/internal/project/HibernateProjectDao.class]: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 0 of type [org.hibernate.SessionFactory]: : Error creating bean with name 'liquibase' defined in class path resource [stash-context.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is liquibase.exception.MigrationFailedException: Migration failed for change set liquibase/r4_0/upgrade.xml::STASHDEV-9922-3::bturner:
     Reason: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Error executing SQL UPDATE [dbo].[plugin_setting] SET [key_name] = substring(key_name, 38, len(key_name) - 38), [namespace] = 'com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge' WHERE namespace = 'com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge': Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'uq_plug_setting_ns_key'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.plugin_setting'. The duplicate key value is (enabled., com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge).:
          Caused By: Error executing SQL UPDATE [dbo].[plugin_setting] SET [key_name] = substring(key_name, 38, len(key_name) - 38), [namespace] = 'com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge' WHERE namespace = 'com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge': Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'uq_plug_setting_ns_key'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.plugin_setting'. The duplicate key value is (enabled., com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge).:
{noformat}

This is occurs when there are more than 1 {{com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge}} entries in the {{plugin_setting}} table (i.e. auto merging has been enabled/disabled for a repository in the branching model at some point.) If there is only 1 entry, it gets improperly renamed to lose the corresponding ID.

h3. Environment
This was tested with MS SQL Server 2012.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Stash 3.x, enable auto merging in the branching model for 2 repositories.
# Perform an upgrade to Bitbucket Server 4.0.0.
# Bitbucket Server fails to start.

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket Server upgrades the database schema correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in the atlassian-bitbucket.log file:
{noformat}
2015-09-23 12:00:39,453 ERROR [spring-startup]  c.a.j.s.w.s.JohnsonDispatcherServlet SpringMVC dispatcher [springMvc] could not be started
org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'crowdUserDao' defined in class path resource [crowd-spi-context.xml]: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 1 of type [com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.ProjectDao]: : Error creating bean with name 'projectDao' defined in URL [jar:file:/opt/atlassian/bitbucket/4.0.0/atlassian-bitbucket/WEB-INF/lib/bitbucket-dao-impl-4.0.0.jar!/com/atlassian/stash/internal/project/HibernateProjectDao.class]: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 0 of type [org.hibernate.SessionFactory]: : Error creating bean with name 'liquibase' defined in class path resource [stash-context.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is liquibase.exception.MigrationFailedException: Migration failed for change set liquibase/r4_0/upgrade.xml::STASHDEV-9922-3::bturner:
     Reason: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Error executing SQL UPDATE [dbo].[plugin_setting] SET [key_name] = substring(key_name, 38, len(key_name) - 38), [namespace] = 'com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge' WHERE namespace = 'com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge': Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'uq_plug_setting_ns_key'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.plugin_setting'. The duplicate key value is (enabled., com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge).:
          Caused By: Error executing SQL UPDATE [dbo].[plugin_setting] SET [key_name] = substring(key_name, 38, len(key_name) - 38), [namespace] = 'com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge' WHERE namespace = 'com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge': Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'uq_plug_setting_ns_key'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.plugin_setting'. The duplicate key value is (enabled., com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge).:
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Stop Bitbucket Server.
# Back up your database.
# Execute the following SQL against your database:
{noformat}
UPDATE  dbo.plugin_setting
SET     key_name = SUBSTRING(key_name, 38, LEN(key_name) - 37)
       ,namespace = 'com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge'
WHERE   namespace = 'com.atlassian.stash.stash-auto-merge';
{noformat}
# Start Bitbucket Server

h3. Possible Side-effects if you did NOT encounter this issue on upgrade

If you upgraded to 4.0.0, and did not encounter the unique key constraint violation, and had auto-merge enabled on any repositories, then your auto-merge settings will have been silently truncated (by chopping the last decimal digit off every repo id). This will result in the auto-merge settings being applied to different repositories and removed from the repository it was set on.
As this silent truncation has lost information, we are unable to provide any automated upgrade task to recover it. 
We suggest retrieving the lost information from your backup taken prior to the upgrade of 4.0.0, and re-enabling the auto-merge settings for those repositories.
fields.summary: SQL Server Database Upgrade Fails Due to Duplicate "com.atlassian.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-auto-merge" Key in plugin_setting

1. Open user drop-down in the top-right corner
2. Open pull request drop-down beside it

Expected:
- User drop-down is closed

Actual
- User drop-down stays open

Please see the screenshot attached
fields.summary: Opening inbox does not close help or user dropdowns
